p: The number of women incarcerated worldwide has increased by 53% since 2000, [ 71] and substance use is clearly present in womenâ€™s prisons [ 17]. A higher proportion of women than men are incarcerated for drug-related offences [ 72]; for example in Europe and Central Asia, an estimated one in four female prisoners has been convicted of a drug offence [ 17]. Sex workers who use drugs are particularly vulnerable, with the dual criminalisation of sex work and drug possession putting them at particularly high risk of incarceration [ 17].
